sentences: David Randall Silveria (born September 21, 1972) is an American drummer, best known as the original drummer for nu metal band Korn from 1993 until leaving the band in 2006.
He then became the drummer for Infinika, which was formed in 2012 and disbanded in 2015.
Born in San Leandro, California, Silveria was raised in Bakersfield.
Silveria sat out a part of the "Sick and Twisted 2000" and "Summer Sanitarium" tours due to injury, with Mike Bordin from Faith No More filling in on drums.

On December 13, 2006, after the tour in support of See You on the Other Side, it was announced that Silveria would be going on hiatus, and Jonathan Davis later said Silveria would "probably not" appear on their next album.
In 2009, after working with several different temporary drummers, Ray Luzier was announced as the official replacement.
For the first time in three years Silveria appeared promoting Lil' Kim in Dancing with the Stars, he also introduced himself as "David Silveria from Korn".
In May 2010, he appeared as a model for Remetee clothing.

Since January 2012, Silveria has become vocal about his time in Korn, and has often spoken negatively about the band, its members and in some cases its outspoken fans, during conversations on Korn fansite Kornspace.com.
He mentioned at that point that he had not spoken with Davis since November 2006.

However, after it was announced that original guitarist Welch would be returning to Korn for two shows at Rock am Ring and Rock im Park in 2013, Silveria commented on his Facebook page that he would be open to a reunion if all five original members were involved.
On August 17, 2013, Silveria responded to the repeated misquoting of his post on Ray Luzier and Korn with "To be clear I am NOT talking bad about Ray.
On February 27, 2015, Silveria stated that he was suing his former bandmates in Korn for money owed after the band declined to allow him back in the group following a lengthy break.
If Silveria is paid what he believes he is owed from the past 9 years, he will dissolve his partnership with the group.
On January 24, it was announced on YouTube that Silveria was playing drums for the experimental rock band Infinika alongside the founding member of ANYONE (and filmmaker) Riz Story.
On January 27, it was confirmed with an article on Blabbermouth.net.
On January 30, fan site Kornspace.com confirmed that Silveria had in fact joined the site, with a picture of Silveria holding a Kornspace banner.
This confirmed previous comments that had supposedly been made by the drummer on the site earlier that week.
On May 22, 2018, it was announced that Silveria and everyone else in the band, aside from their two frontmen, had quit the band due to mixed reviews and creative differences.
Silveria married Shannon Bellino in 1997 but the couple divorced a few years later; they have two children together, born in 1997 and 1999.
